business.headline: Why family offices are crucial to India's 'Viksit Bharat by 2047' dream?At the India Today Conclave 2025, Rishabh Shroff, Partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, discussed the growing role of family offices in India's journey towards becoming a developed economy by 2047. In a session titled "A Case for Tomorrow", moderated by Siddharth Zarabi, Shroff explained why family offices are vital for India's economic expansion and how they can contribute to achieving a Rs 30 trillion GDP target in the coming decades.

US Gold Card visa expensive, not worth it for Indians: Top law firm bossRishabh Shroff, partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, said Donald Trump's $5 million US Gold Card visa does not make sense for Indians as cheaper alternatives are available.

Why are the richest 1% leaving India? Law firm boss Rishabh Shroff explains Rishabh Shroff, Partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, shared insights into the rising trend of high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs) acquiring foreign passports and moving their wealth abroad.

Pay is based on capability, not gender: Avarna Jain on pay gap in music industryAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Avarna Jain, Vice Chairperson of Saregama, spoke about the role of women in the workforce and addressed the long-debated issue of pay parity in the music and entertainment industry. She stated that in creative fields, women are leading the way, and pay is determined by ability and capability, not gender.

Place of TV will never be taken away: Anu Ranjan on OTTs replacing TVAnu Ranjan, President of The Indian Television Academy, said that television will remain relevant despite the rise of OTT platforms at the India Today Conclave 2025. She explained that while digital streaming services are growing, they cannot replace television, mainly due to affordability and accessibility.

Conclave 2025: Women leaders on breaking barriers, challenges and leadershipAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Namita Thapar, Executive Director of Emcure Pharmaceuticals, stated that businesses should be evaluated based on numbers, not gender. Speaking at the session "Breaking Barriers and Building Legacies," Thapar stressed that success in business depends on financial results, not whether a man or woman runs it.

Dalal Street logs best week of 2025. Will positive momentum continue?After a long spell of selling, investors on Dalal Street have finally got some relief. But does this mean the worst is over? Here is all you need to know.

Businesses should be judged by numbers, not gender: Namita Thapar International Women's Day: Namita Thapar, Executive Director of Emcure Pharmaceuticals, highlighted how financial results remain the key factor in business success, regardless of whether a man or a woman runs the company.

Women investors outpacing men in mutual fund investments: ReportThere's a common belief that women prefer safer investments, but the data challenges that view. More women are actively investing in mutual funds and surpassing men in key areas.

These 3 money deadlines you can't miss in March 2025If you want to secure better returns, deposit in these special fixed deposits, which are available only for a limited period. The last date for investing in these schemes is March 31, 2025.

Bengaluru's housing rent crisis triggers online debate. Details hereA recent social media post has ignited debate over Bengaluru's soaring rents, with users sharing how housing costs are outpacing salaries and making city living unaffordable.

ad:tech New Delhi unveils ad:techHonours to recognise marketing tech innovationHeld on March 6 at Yashobhoomi, in collaboration with the International Advertising Association (IAA) India Chapter, this event brought together industry leaders to honour the innovators shaping the future of tech-driven marketing.

entertainment.headline: Viral: Shawn Mendes sings Senorita on Mumbai street ahead of concertCanadian singer Shawn Mendes, who is currently in India, performed his hit song Senorita on a Mumbai street on Saturday, much to the delight of his fans.

Zahan Kapoor reflects on celebrityhood, Kapoor legacy and Black Warrant's successActor Zahan Kapoor opened up about his career, his latest Netflix show, Black Warrant, his famous cousins, and more, at the India Today Conclave 2025 held in New Delhi on Saturday.

Mindy Kaling reacts to criticism of Meghan Markle's With Love, MeghanActor and creator Mindy Kaling has finally reacted to the criticism of Meghan Markle's lifestyle series, With Love, Meghan. The show premiered on Netflix on March 4.

The Electric State review: Russo Brothers' dystopian film sparks and fizzles outReleased-Fri Mar 14, 2025The Netflix film, 'The Electric State' falls short of entertainment. The chemistry between Millie Bobbie Brown and Chris Pratt looks awkward, while the bots don't do enough to keep the excitement alive.

Nadaaniyan X reviews: Internet shreds Ibrahim-Khushi's film, calls it trashyNadaaniyan, starring Ibrahim Ali Khan and Khushi Kapoor, debuts on Netflix to widespread criticism, with viewers and critics alike branding it 'unbearable' and 'trashy'.

Ruby review: A debut album that's ambitious, polished, and unapologetically Jennie Blackpink's Jennie's debut solo album, Ruby, is a bold exploration of her musical identity, featuring 15 tracks that delve into themes of empowerment and self-discovery.

Meghan Markle's With Love, Meghan renewed for season 2 amid criticismThe Duchess of Sussex, Meghan Markle, has announced a second season of her Netflix series, With Love, Meghan. The show premiered on the OTT giant on March 4.

BB OTT 3 fame Kritika-Armaan Malik's son Zaid diagnosed with ricketsBigg Boss OTT 3 fame Kritika Malik and husband Armaan Malik's son, Zaid has been diagnosed with rickets. The news was shared by Armaan's first wife, Payal Malik, in her latest vlog.

general news.headline: Critics said Mrityu Kumbh, devotees showed it's Mrityunjay Kumbh: Yogi AdityanathIndia Today Conclave: Yogi Adityanath said that the huge number of devotees turnout at Maha Kumbh silenced those who made negative comments about the religious gathering.

He pointed out that at the heart of this was the Nalanda University in Bihar, which Dalrymple described as the "Oxford, Cambridge, or NASA of its day."

1 dead, 27 security personnel hurt in Manipur as Kukis clash with forces: SourcesThe clashes occurred as locals defied Union Home Minister Amit Shah's directive for the free movement of all vehicles across Manipur starting today.

Telangana has Hyderabad, what do you have? Nara Lokesh's 'Deewar' style replySpeaking at the India Today Conclave, Andhra Pradesh IT and Human Resources Minister Minister Nara Lokesh said Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu was the competitive advantage that their state had.

India, not China, centre of ancient trade: William Dalrymple debunks popular historyIndia was the centre of ancient trade, not China, historian William Dalrymple said, debunking popular historical claims at the India Today Conclave.

Actor Gene Hackman lived with wife's corpse for a week, say officialsThe late Gene Hackman reportedly lived with his wife Betsy's dead body for a week, before he succumbed to heart disease. The medical officials have now disclosed why that was.

Israeli tourist, homestay host raped in Hampi, male friend's body found in canalThree male companions, who were with the women, were assaulted and then thrown into a canal near Hampi in Karnataka. While two of them managed to come out of the waters, the body of another was recovered this morning.

Pfizer Covid vaccine rushed to market, led to reproductive damages: Dr Naomi WolfWolf, who stated that she is not vaccinated against Covid-19, claimed that live birth rates have dropped by 13-20%, attributing the decline to adverse effects of the vaccines.

Lalit Modi acquires Vanuatu citizenship: All about Pacific island nationVanuatu, a tropical paradise in the Pacific, has drawn global attention after former IPL chief Lalit Modi acquired its citizenship. AI must serve us, not rule us: Guru Gauranga Das on digital clonesAs AI and digital cloning evolve, the debate intensifies—can technology grant us digital immortality, or will it redefine what it means to be human? While AI assists in preserving memories, true wisdom lies in ensuring that human values and ethics remain at the core.

KL Rahul at number 6 is great for the team: India batting coach praises batterKL Rahul has embraced his new No. 6 role, providing India with stability and finishing power ahead of the Champions Trophy Final, as praised by batting coach Sitanshu Kotak for his adaptability and crucial contributions.

Sitanshu Kotak: India have great batters, unfair to say my arrival changed thingsChampions Trophy Final: Batting coach Sitanshu Kotak addressed the press during India's training session on Friday. The former Saurashtra captain said he doesn't want credit for India's strong batting in the tournament. Kotak joined Gautam Gambhir's coaching staff after India's poor batting display in the 2024-25 Test series in Australia.

New Zealand hoping for an 'off day' for Indian spinners in Champions Trophy finalNew Zealand head coach Gary Stead is hoping for a bad day from the Indian spin-quartet in the final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Batting coach echoes Gautam Gambhir's stance, rejects Dubai advantage criticismChampions Trophy 2025: Speaking to the press during India's training session in Dubai on Friday, batting coach Sitanshu Kotak hit out at critics, dismissing claims that India enjoy an advantage by playing all their games in Dubai.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.
